page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY SINCE 1800
page.content: The present Greenock road was begun in 1793, and the railway from Paisley to Greenock started in 1841. Bishopton Primary School is the oldest in the district, and was known as Erskine Public School until 1971. The village in the 1930's, unlike nowadays, had a wide variety of shops. There was a grocer with a tea-room, a dry-salter, 2 greengrocers, a draper and later, a joiners. The post office was located in the present newsagent's shop, while its present site was a radio and hardware shop. The Bank of Scotland was built for the British Linen Bank, and the present chemist's and hairdresser's was the Commercial Bank. There were also a cobbler, a fishmonger (later a bicycle shop), a joiner/coffinmaker and a baker. The major growth in the village coincided with expansion of the R.O.F. in WW2.
